ITAL 376-1   Italian Cinema. Neorealism to the present (same as FILM 395R)
(Castaldo / MW 10:00-11:15AM in person + weekly asynchronous film screenings).
 
ITAL 376: History of Italian Cinema (Cross-listed with Film Studies)
Content: A history of Italian cinema from mid 20th century to present day. This class will address both major and less known movements, directors, and genres, devoting particular attention to neorealist films and aesthetics in the light of their international resonance.  We will focus on historical topics, including fascism and antifascism, youth culture, class   struggle, terrorism, mafia, migration and film aesthetics (construction of pathos, landscape, memory, charisma).   Authors will include well known personalities such as Roberto Rossellini, Michelangelo Antonioni, Liliana Cavani, and contemporary filmmakers who are renewing Italian Film  Aesthetics, such as Alice Rohrwacher, Laura Bispuri, and Pietro Marcello. 
Class will be in English. Weekly online screening required (all films will be subtitled in English). All readings will be posted on canvas.
course_description: Close study of the development of a specific national or regional cinema in terms of aesthetic, theoretical, and sociopolitical dimensions. Weekly screenings required.
prerequisites: FILM 102 and (FILM 201 or FILM 202 or FILM 203 or FILM 204) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
